intro: Waltheria nipensis, commonly known as the narrowleaf waltheria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. Waltheria nipensis is often found in open habitats and is adapted to thrive in humid, subtropical climates.
